title: Building MPI programs on Cray (Theta) no longer works

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

When I try to build mpi-using packages on Cray (ALCF Theta), the build fails.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack spec osu-micro-benchmarks
Input spec
--------------------------------
osu-micro-benchmarks

Concretized
--------------------------------
osu-micro-benchmarks@5.6.3%gcc@9.3.0~cuda arch=cray-cnl7-mic_knl
    ^mpich@7.7.14%gcc@9.3.0~argobots~benvolio+fortran+hwloc+hydra+libxml2+pci+romio~slurm~verbs+wrapperrpath device=ch3 netmod=tcp pmi=pmi arch=cray-cnl7-mic_knl
$ spack install osu-micro-benchmarks

### Error Message

```console

==> mpich@7.7.14 : has external module in ['cray-mpich/7.7.14']
[+] /opt/cray/pe/mpt/7.7.14/gni/mpich-gnu/8.2 (external mpich-7.7.14-kkqdu3ssedubdlhqgztyvujw7f64xa3h)
==> Installing osu-micro-benchmarks-5.6.3-tbj2gfm3urlhe43u3wr27jgfxwbpives
==> No binary for osu-micro-benchmarks-5.6.3-tbj2gfm3urlhe43u3wr27jgfxwbpives found: installing from source
==> Error: CompilerAccessError: Compiler 'gcc@9.3.0' has executables that are missing or are not executable: ['CC', 'ftn', 'ftn']

/gpfs/mira-home/robl/src/spack/lib/spack/spack/build_environment.py:863, in _setup_pkg_and_run:
        860        tb_string = traceback.format_exc()
        861
        862        # build up some context from the offending package so we can
  >>    863        # show that, too.
        864        package_context = get_package_context(tb)
        865
        866        logfile = None

```

### Information on your system

```
% spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.0
* **Python:** 3.6.10
* **Platform:** cray-sles15-haswell
```

This is the ALCF Cray "Theta" system, bane of my spack experiences

I do not see this problem with spack-0.15.4

I do see this problem with spack-0.16.0
<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->

I trick spack by telling it cray-mpich is mpich:

```
packages.yaml
packages:
...
      mpich:
    modules:
      mpich@7.7.14: cray-mpich/7.7.14
    buildable: False
....
```

### Additional information
